item.title: I wanted to blog with Emacs to https://micro.blog/. First I created https://github.com/kinnala/blog repo with /index.org/ and enabled https://docs.github.com/en/pages/getting-started-with-github-pages/creating-a-github-pages-site from its settings. Then I installed https://github.com/emacsmirror/ox-rss from Emacsmirror. Finally I wrote ✏️ this entry in /index.org/, ran /org-rss-export-to-rss/ and /org-html-export-to-html/, and committed the resulting files.
item.author: tom@tunkki (Tom Gustafsson)

item.title: Connecting the resulting blog to https://micro.blog/ requires just the url kinnala.github.io/blog/index.xml. However, I noticed org-mode titles are interpreted as the actual entries ✏️. This means the html export puts everything inside /<h1>/ tags. Perhaps it requires tinkering at some point.
item.author: tom@tunkki (Tom Gustafsson)
